instxt.txt: You have to answer 10 multiple choice questions.
You need to score a minimum of 70% to pass the test.
Click Enter to begin the test.

Main.QUESTION: Defect prevention is
______________ is the critical starting point of Lean thinking
To get First Hand Information, we need to do
Value is always defined from the perspective of the
______________ is a Visual Control device in the work area indicating a process or quality problem
______________ is the rate (time per unit of value) at which work should proceed through a Value Stream
This technique can be used to conduct root cause analysis
Pull system helps in avoiding ______________
Placing everything in its place is part of _________________in 5S framework
Creation of a level schedule by sequencing orders in order to smoothen the demand is known as ______________
Kaizen as implemented in Lean helps in the following
Main.OPTION3: Ongoing small changes suggested by external process consultant
Main.OPTION4: One time significant change suggested by external process consultant

Main.QUESTION: Continuous organization learning and improvement is ensured through ______________
Main purpose of Visual control is to
Main.OPTION1: Create dashboards and metrics for measurement
Main.OPTION3: Help in baselining and measuring the trends
Main.OPTION4: Showcase to the management on the success stories of the team

Main.QUESTION: VSM helps in
Main.OPTION1: Identifying areas where automation can be implemented
Main.OPTION2: Identifying areas for putting mistake proofing process
Main.OPTION3: Identifying value adding and non value adding activity in a process
Main.OPTION4: Identifying areas where Visual control can be implemented
Main.ANSWER: Identifying value adding and non value adding activity in a process

Main.QUESTION: PDCA stands for
Which of the following is not a root cause analysis technique
The culture of Lean gives a lot of importance to
Identifying the necessary and removing unwanted one in any workplace is called
What is the typical first step towards identifying the area of waste elimination in a project
Kaizen applied with the right approach helps in achieving
'Value' in Lean terms is a deliverable to the client which is usable. Identify which statements below qualify for this Value definition
Main.OPTION1: Value for a recruitment group is each human resource made available to the project teams
Main.OPTION2: Value for a Maintenance project is the Bugs serviced per release
Main.OPTION3: Value for a Conversion project is every web page converted

Main.QUESTION: Identify Type 2 "Waste" in these scenarios
Main.OPTION1: Waiting and searching for resources in the lab during reproduction and testing
Main.OPTION2: Capturing relevant information in defect tracker
Main.OPTION4: Frequent build cycles, frequent code reviews and early testing
Main.ANSWER: Waiting and searching for resources in the lab during reproduction and testing

Main.QUESTION: Workload leveling is
Main.OPTION1: Assiging important tasks to key resources only
Main.OPTION2: Allocating the tasks as and when they queue up
Main.OPTION3: Allocating the right tasks to team members based on effort,complexity estimates, skill level
Main.OPTION4: Dividing and assigning the same tasks to multiple people
Main.ANSWER: Allocating the right tasks to team members based on effort,complexity estimates, skill level

Main.QUESTION: What is Lean?
Main.OPTION1: Creating value from the perspective of a customer

Main.QUESTION: When should I start implementing Lean principles in a project?
Main.OPTION2: When there is a problem in the project
Main.OPTION3: When the project gets kicked off
Main.ANSWER: When the project gets kicked off

Main.QUESTION: During which phase of the project can Lean be implemented?

The delivery team uses white boards to monitor the status of the tickets, automates routine jobs, maintains checklist and implements learning from previous releases. The team does not have a knowledge of Lean and has never attended any Lean training sessions. Is Lean being practiced in the project
The management decisions in a company practicing Lean philosophy is based on
Main.OPTION3: Long term thinking even at short term financial expense
Main.OPTION4: Medium term thinking but with high operating margins
Main.ANSWER: Long term thinking even at short term financial expense

Main.QUESTION: Which of the following are two key pillars of the Toyota Production System?
The culture of stopping when there is a quality problem is called
Which of the following is a technique involving simple inexpensive automatic mechanisms or manual inspection in a station, that makes the quality issues obvious at a glance?

Lean principle is based on management decisions adopting a _____________ philosophy"
What is the main purpose of Visual Controls?
Main.OPTION1: To show status to upper management
Main.OPTION3: To bring out operational problems affecting for early resolution
Main.ANSWER: To bring out operational problems affecting for early resolution

Main.QUESTION: Which of the following is NOT part of 5 S?

Main.OPTION3: Leaders going to the actual workplace to see and understand throughly

In a maintenance project with a 3 month release cycle, the team idles during the first six weeks due to lack of clarity. The customer expects team to work as per the planned efforts in the remaining 6 weeks. This will lead to _______________
The purpose of VSM is to ____________ and eliminate waste
_______________ is the time taken for those activities that actually transform the product/service in a way that the customer is willing to pay for
Those activities that are not mandatory to provide what customer wants are _______________

Principles of 5S aim at achieving

Standardized work and environment are the basis for
An operating model with in-station quality is found in
Use of code analysis tools as the code is developed is an example of _______________
Kaizen is _______________
Main.OPTION1: An activity that causes an incidental problem
Main.OPTION2: An activity that causes a recurrent problem
Main.OPTION3: An activity that enables continuous improvement
Main.ANSWER: An activity that enables continuous improvement

Main.QUESTION: The 5 Ws of root cause analysis are
Automatically stopping the process when something is wrong and then fixing the problems on the line itself as they occur is called _______________

Main.OPTION1: Doing work manually when it can be automated
Main.OPTION3: Spending efforts in processing repetitive issues

Main.OPTION2: The activity must "directly transform" the item or person flowing through the process into what the customer is willing to pay for.

Main.QUESTION: A checklist is a simple example for _______________

Main.OPTION4: Identify the Value added and Non value added activities
